info.title: myclimate calculator APIs
info.description:
The myclimate calculator APIs can be used to calculate carbon emissions for various transportation types and products. If you are interested in using our APIs, please contact us to get credentials. We provide access to our calculator APIs for a licence fee and only for projects with an integrated function to contribute to climate protection projects.
For educational projects on a high education level we offer access to our calculator APIs for free.

We are currently offering APIs to calculate carbon emissions for the following entities. These APIs accept a single entity (e.g. a single flight).

- flights
- car trips
- cruises
- companies
- personal footprint

Additionally, we offer bulk APIs which allow to receive a list of the same entities (e.g. a list of flights). The API's response includes carbon emissions per single entity as well as the total emissions of all entities. These are supported for the following entities:

- flights
- cars

Our bulk APIs accept data either as CSV or JSON.

Our APIs are built to sustain one request per second. If you require higher load, please let us know.

Because the API requires authorization, it is not possible to query it directly in the frontend via Javascript. The query is made from server to server.

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions of a single flight
post.description:
The myclimate flight API calculates the carbon emissions of a single flight. It supports detailed parameters such as flight class or stopover airport.

If you want to calculate multiple flights at once, use the bulk flight API instead.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

Refer to the detailed [documentation of the myclimate flight calculator](https://www.myclimate.org/en/information/about-myclimate/downloads/flight-emission-calculator/) to learn more about how flight emissions are calculated.

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions for a single car trip

errors.description: only present when there were errors in the request

post.description:
The myclimate car API calculates the carbon emissions of a single car trip. It supports many different fuel types and allows the estimation of the car's fuel consumption if it is not known.

If you want to calculate multiple car trips at once, use the bulk car API instead.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions of a holiday on a cruise ship
post.description:
The myclimate cruise API calculates the carbon emissions of a holiday on a cruise ship. It supports many parameters such as the size of the ship, the cabin type or for how many people would like to calculate the emmisions.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions for multiple flights (JSON)

id.description: Customer reference provided in the input value of this specific flight.

fuel_kg_per_passenger.description: The amount of fuel used per passenger.

sum_kg.description: The sum of carbon emissions of all calculated flights

sum_km.description: The sum of the calculated distance of all flights

id.description: A customer reference for this specific flight. The API returns that same reference in the response.

requestBody.description: Every object in the `flights` array represents a single flight.

post.description:
The bulk flight calculator allows to calculate carbon emissions of multiple flights at once. It supports JSON and CSV as input.

We offer the following solutions to calculate carbon emissions for multiple flights:

- API which accepts either JSON or CSV (this endpoint)
- A [web UI](https://api.myclimate.org/v1/flight_bulk_entry/new)
- A [CSV upload tool](https://api.myclimate.org)

Both the web UI and the CSV upload tool can be used without programming knowledge and do not require development effort.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions of multiple car trips (JSON)

km.description: Returned as delivered in the input

fuel_type.description: Returned as delivered in the input

fuel_consumption.description: Returned as delivered in the input

electric_location.description: Returned as delivered in the input

status.description: Either `OK` or an error message such as `km: must be greater than or equal to 1`

car_type.description: Returned as delivered in the input

post.description:
The bulk car calculator allows to calculate carbon emissions of multiple car trips at once. It supports JSON and CSV as input.

We offer the following solutions to calculate carbon emissions for multiple car trips:

- API which accepts either JSON or CSV (this endpoint)
- A [CSV upload tool](https://api.myclimate.org)

The CSV upload tool can be used without programming knowledge and does not require development effort.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions of a company

kg.description:
total carbon emissions in `kg`
sum of `energy_kg`, `mobility_kg`, `food_kg` and `supplies_kg`

price_in_eur_cents.description:
price in EUR to contribute to climate protection projects according to the total carbon emissions
note that this parameter is only present in the response if agreed so with myclimate

price_in_chf_rappen.description:
price in CHF to contribute to climate protection projects according to the total carbon emissions
note that this parameter is only present in the response if agreed so with myclimate

input_params.description: lists all input parameters as they have been used in the calculation

post.description:
Calculates carbon emissions using the [myclimate company calculator](https://co2.myclimate.org/en/company_calculators/new).

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

The calculation parameters are divided into five sections:

- Energy
- Digital Services
- Mobility
- Food and beverages
- Supplies

Each of the sections can either be estimated or calculated precisely.

The API returns carbon emissions per each of the sections as well as the total sum.

## Providing Parameters

Depending on which data is available, each section in the calculator can be estimated or calculated based on provided data. For some sections this is done on an even finer scale. 
For example, it is possible to estimate energy emissions based on empirical data and estimated values. If energy data is available, the emissions can be calculated more precisely.
Some sections cannot be estimated, e.g. flight emissions as part of mobility data. Flight emission data have to be provided or set to zero (if flights are not applicable). 

The following list defines which parameters need to be provided in which situation:

### Always required

- `name`
- `country`
- `number_of_employees`
- `heated_area`

### Energy information

Only provide if `estimate_energy` is `0`.

- `power_consumption_kwh`
- `green_electricity`
- `oil_liters`
- `natural_gas_m3`
- `biogas_m3`
- `district_heat_kwh`
- `wood_kwh`
- `heat_pump`

### Digital Services information

Only provide if `estimate_digital_services` is `0`.
- `cloud_storage_gbyte`
- `web_data_transfer_gbyte`

### Mobility information

#### Commuting

Only provide if `estimate_commuting_mobility` is `0`:

- `commuted_yearly_public_transportation_km`
- `commuted_yearly_car_km`

#### Business Trips

Only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0`
and if `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `0`:
- `business_yearly_car_km`

Only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0`
and if `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `1`:
- `car_fuel_gasoline_liters`
- `car_fuel_diesel_liters`
- `car_fuel_natural_gas_kg`
- `car_fuel_biogas_kg`
- `car_fuel_electric_kwh`

In case of public transportation or accomodation provide:
- `business_yearly_public_transportation_km`
- `hotel_nights_amount`

#### Flights

If you want to include flights in the calculation, even if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0`, provide: 

- `short_flights_amount`
- `medium_flights_amount`
- `long_flights_amount`
- `business_or_first_flights_per_cent`

If you don't provide precise flight data, it will be set to `0`, by default.

### Food and beverages

Only provide if `estimate_food_and_beverages` is `0`.

- `warm_meal_meat_amount`
- `warm_meal_vegetarian_amount`
- `snacks`
- `soda_liters`
- `coffee_portions`
- `tea_portions`

### Supplies

Only provide if `estimate_supplies` is `0`.

#### Material

- `paper_kg`
- `paper_recycling_paper_per_cent`
- `printed_matters_kg`
- `electronic_devices_amount`

If more data is known and `consider_advanced_supplies_inputs` is `1`:

- `toners_amount`
- `water_m3`

#### Garbage

- `garbage_kg`
- `garbage_recycling_kg`
- `garbage_electronics_kg`

number_of_employees.description: Number of full-time positions. Two 70% employees result in a value of `1.4`.

estimate_energy.description: `1` if energy consumption is not known and should be estimated. In this case, do not provide `power_consumption_kwh`, `green_electricity`, `oil_liters`, `natural_gas_m3`, `biogas_m3`, `district_heat_kwh`, `wood_kwh`, `heat_pump`

power_consumption_kwh.description: In `kWh`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

oil_liters.description: In liters. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

natural_gas_m3.description: in `m3`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

biogas_m3.description: In `m3`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

district_heat_kwh.description: in `kWh`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

heat_pump.description: Record heat pumpâ€™s energy consumption as part of your total energy consumption. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

wood_kwh.description: In `kWh`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

estimate_digital_services.description: `1` if digital service usage is not known and should be estimated. In this case, do not provide `cloud_storage_gbyte`, `web_data_transfer_gbyte`

cloud_storage_gbyte.description: In `GigaByte`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`

web_data_transfer_gbyte.description:
In `GigaByte`. Do not provide if `estimate_energy` is `1`. Annual amount of company data transferred or downloaded to external servers/providers.
This includes, for example, cloud storage, streaming services, web browsing or communications (email, chats).

estimate_commuting_mobility.description:
`1` if commuting mobility emissions should be estimated. In this case, do not provide `commuted_yearly_public_transportation_km`, 
`commuted_yearly_car_km`

estimate_business_trip_mobility.description:
`1` if business trip mobility emissions should be estimated. In this case, do not provide 
`business_yearly_car_km`, `car_fuel_gasoline_liters`,`car_fuel_diesel_liters`, `car_fuel_natural_gas_kg`, `car_fuel_biogas_kg`, `car_fuel_electric_kwh`, `business_yearly_public_transportation_km`, `hotel_nights_amount`

business_yearly_car_km.description: only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0` and `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `0`

car_fuel_electric_kwh.description: only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0` and `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `1`

car_fuel_gasoline_liters.description: only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0` and `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `1`

car_fuel_diesel_liters.description: only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0` and `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `1`

car_fuel_natural_gas_kg.description: only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0` and `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `1`

car_fuel_biogas_kg.description: only provide if `estimate_business_trip_mobility` is `0` and `consider_advanced_business_trip_inputs` is `1`

short_flights_amount.description: Up to 3 hours of flight time. Note that roundtrip flights count as 2 flights

medium_flights_amount.description: 3-6 hours of flight time. Note that roundtrip flights count as 2 flights

long_flights_amount.description: more than 6 hours of flight time. Note that roundtrip flights count as 2 flights

business_or_first_flights_per_cent.description: In percentage, e.g. `50.3` if the value is `50.3%`.

estimate_food_and_beverages.description:
`1` if food and beverages consumption is not known and should be estimated. In this case, do not provide
`warm_meal_meat_amount`, `warm_meal_vegetarian_amount`, `snacks`, `soda_liters`, `coffee_portions`, `tea_portions`

snacks.description: Number of snacks per day. Only provide if `estimate_food_and_beverages` is `0`

soda_liters.description:
in liters per day
consumption of mineral water and soda
only provide if `estimate_food_and_beverages` is `0`

coffee_portions.description: In cups. Only provide if `estimate_food_and_beverages` is `1`

tea_portions.description: In cups. Only provide if `estimate_food_and_beverages` is `0`

estimate_supplies.description:
`1` if supplies consumption is not known and should be estimated. In this case, do not provide
`paper_kg`, `paper_recycling_paper_per_cent`, `printed_matters_kg`, `electronic_devices_amount`, `toners_amount`, `water_m3`, `garbage_kg`, `garbage_recycling_kg`, `garbage_electronics_kg`

electronic_devices_amount.description: Number of new computers, laptops, monitors, etc. bought. Only provide if `estimate_supplies` is `0` and

toners_amount.description: only provide if `estimate_supplies` is `0` and `consider_advanced_supplies_inputs` is `1`

water_m3.description: only provide if `estimate_supplies` is `0` and `consider_advanced_supplies_inputs` is `1`

garbage_recycling_kg.description: only provide if `estimate_supplies` is `0` and `consider_advanced_garbage_inputs` is `1`

garbage_electronics_kg.description: only provide if `estimate_supplies` is `0` and `consider_advanced_garbage_inputs` is `1`

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions for multiple flights (CSV)
post.description:
The bulk flight calculator allows to calculate carbon emissions of multiple flights at once. It supports JSON and CSV as input.

We offer the following solutions to calculate carbon emissions for multiple flights:

- API which accepts either JSON or CSV (this endpoint)
- A [web UI](https://api.myclimate.org/v1/flight_bulk_entry/new)
- A [CSV upload tool](https://api.myclimate.org)

Both the web UI and the CSV upload tool can be used without programming knowledge and do not require development effort.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

requestBody.description:
## Transmission

Send the CSV file as `multipart/form-data` and name the property `csv_file`. The value of that property should be a reference to the embedded CSV file (sending the CSV content as a value of that property is not accepted).

**Note:** Sending the CSV content as the body in the HTTP request is not supported. You have to use `multipart/form-data` as explained above.

## CSV Format

Every line in the CSV sent to the API represents a single flight. In the CSV returned by the API, the calculated carbon emissions are appended to each line.

Please note that a line including column headers should not be included in the CSV.

The fields required for each line are:

1. an arbitrary reference (ignored by the myclimate calculator, returned to you unchanged)
2. start airport (a 3-letter IATA code)
3. destination airport (a 3-letter IATA code)
4. flight class (`first`, `business` or `economy`)

The returned CSV contains all of the input columns and the following additional columns (appended at the end of the line):

1. CO2eq emissions (in kg)
2. relevant flight distance (in km)
3. amount of used fuel per passenger (in kg)
4. contribution amount in cents (only present if your API key is configured to return EUR prices)
5. contribution amount in rappens (only present if your API key is configured to return CHF prices)
6. status message: either `OK` or an error description as e.g. `to: Could not find airport`.

## Testing Using cURL

You can use an HTTP command-line client like cURL to send requests to the API directly for testing purposes.

Use the `--user` option to send your username and password separated by a colon.

The `-F` option lets cURL emulate a filled-in form. This causes it to `POST` data using `Content-Type: multipart/form-data` according to [RFC 2388](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2388.txt). To load the file, prefix the file name with an `@` sign. You can also tell cURL what `Content-Type` to use by using `type=`.

`
curl -â€”user username:password -F
"csv_file=@your_file.csv;type=text/csv"
https://api.myclimate.org/v1/bulk_flight_calculators
`

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions of multiple car trips (CSV)
post.description:
The bulk flight calculator allows to calculate carbon emissions of multiple flights at once. It supports JSON and CSV as input.

We offer the following solutions to calculate carbon emissions for multiple flights:

- API which accepts either JSON or CSV (this endpoint)
- A [web UI](https://api.myclimate.org/v1/flight_bulk_entry/new)
- A [CSV upload tool](https://api.myclimate.org)

Both the web UI and the CSV upload tool can be used without programming knowledge and do not require development effort.

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

requestBody.description:
## Transmission

Send the CSV file as `multipart/form-data` and name the property `csv_file`. The value of that property should be a reference to the embedded CSV file (sending the CSV content as a value of that property is not accepted).

**Note:** Sending the CSV content as the body in the HTTP request is not supported. You have to use `multipart/form-data` as explained above.

## CSV Format

Every line in the CSV sent to the API represents a single car trip. In the CSV returned by the API, the calculated carbon emissions are appended to each line.

Please note that a line including column headers should not be included in the CSV.

The fields required for each line are:

1. an arbitrary reference (ignored by the myclimate calculator, returned to you unchanged)
2. length of the trip (in km)
3. car type
4. fuel type
5. fuel consumption
6. electric location

Your input should only contain ASCII printable characters. Sending Umlauts or other non-ascii characters will lead to an error.
Refer to the documentation of the car API for single car trips for further documentation on each field.

The returned CSV contains all of the input columns and the following additional columns (appended at the end of the line):

1. CO2eq emissions (in kg)
2. contribution amount in cents (only present if your API key is configured to return EUR prices)
3. contribution amount in rappens (only present if your API key is configured to return CHF prices)
4. status message: either `OK` or an error description as e.g. `km: must be greater than or equal to 1.`

## Testing Using cURL

You can use an HTTP command-line client like cURL to send requests to the API directly for testing purposes.

Use the `--user` option to send your username and password separated by a colon.

The `-F` option lets cURL emulate a filled-in form. This causes it to `POST` data using `Content-Type: multipart/form-data` according to [RFC 2388](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2388.txt). To load the file, prefix the file name with an `@` sign. You can also tell cURL what `Content-Type` to use by using `type=`.

`
curl -â€”user username:password -F
"csv_file=@your_file.csv;type=text/csv"
https://api.myclimate.org/v1/bulk_flight_calculators
`

post.summary: Calculate carbon emissions of a personal footprint

household_heating: is not included in the list
is not included in the list

post.description:
The myclimate footprint API calculates the carbon emissions of a footprint of a single person. It takes emissions into account from different areas of live, such as mobility or consumption.

To understand the values used in the footprint API (such as `low` or `medium`), please refer to the [questions and answers on the web version of the footprint calculator](https://co2.myclimate.org/en/footprint_calculators/new).

If you agreed on a climate protection contribution amount per ton with myclimate, the API can return the according amount to contribute to climate protection for the calculated emissions in EUR and/or CHF. Please contact us whether you would like to use this feature and if so, in which currencies.

from.description: departure airport, a 3-letter IATA airport code

to.description: destination airport, a 3-letter IATA airport code

via.description: stopover airport, a 3-letter IATA airport code

passengers.description: number of passengers the carbon emissions should be calculated for

roundtrip.description: whether the flight is one way (roundtrip is `false`) or if the return flight should be included as well (roundtrip is `true`)

km.description: only present when there were no errors in the request

fuel_kg_per_passenger.description: only present when there were no errors in the request

FlightCalculatorErrors.title: Errors
FlightCalculatorErrors.description: only present when errors are present in the request

items.example: is not included in the list
is not included in the list

CarCalculatorInput.title: CarCalculatorInput

car_type.description: Used for the estimation of fuel consumption. Specify the `car_type` only if `fuel_consumption` is not known.

fuel_type.description: type of fuel used by the car

fuel_consumption.description: Average amount of fuel consumed by the car when travelling 100km. When specifying `fuel_consumption`, do not specify `car_type`.

electric_location.description: required if `fuel_type` is `electric` or `plug_in_hybrid`, defines which power mix is used to charge the car

CarCalculatorInput.description: The preferred calculation method is to supply `fuel_consumption`. If that is not known, a `car_type` can be specified and the average fuel consumption is estimated. Note that if `fuel_consumption` is supplied, `car_type` is ignored.

PriceEUR.title: PriceEUR
PriceEUR.description: only present when agreed on returning a price in EUR

PriceCHF.title: PriceCHF
PriceCHF.description: only present when agreed on returning a price in CHF

CO2eqkg.title: CO2eqkg
CO2eqkg.description:
carbon equivalent emissions in kg
only present when there were no errors in the request

cruise_duration.description: duration of the whole cruise in days (including both days on sea and days in harbour)

number_of_occupants.description: number of people staying in the cabin

cruise_days_with_port_call.description: number of days with port call during the cruise, can't exceed the duration of the cruise

BulkCustomerReference.title: BulkCustomerReference
BulkCustomerReference.description: An arbitrary reference which is returned to you in the response. Useful to crossreference the same flight or car trip from the input to the output.

Basic.description:
The myclimate APIs use HTTP basic authentication. You need a username and password to connect to any of them. Please contact us if you are interested.

Note that due to the unencrypted basic authentication, myclimate APIs are only available via HTTPS.

Many programming languages, frameworks or tools support basic authentication. Supply them the username and password you got from myclimate to authenticate.

If the framework used does not support basic authentication, include an HTTP header called `Authorization` with the content `Basic <mysecret>`. Replace `<mysecret>` with the Base64-encoded concatenation of the provided username and password, separated by a colon `:`.

**Example**

Assume your username is `acme` and your password is `secret`. Concatenate both and separate them with a colon. You get: `acme:secret`. Encode that whole string using Base64 to get `YWNtZTpzZWNyZXQ=`. Your HTTP header `Authorization` should then have the content `Basic YWNtZTpzZWNyZXQ=`.
